attributes.comment:
I was surprised to hear that you were raising your filing fees by over 60%. I am
trying to adopt a baby from China and I can't tell you how expensive it is without a
huge increase in fees. You know the expression, "nickel and dime you to death"?
I feel like I am being "hundred dollared" to death for doing something that is at its
core a good deed. I am not sure that these fees are something that should be
based on full cost recovery. A greater public good is being served by a private act
and some recognition, in the form of a cost break should be considered. I am not
saying get rid of the fees entirely, but don't start raising them so high that it
discourages people from doing something good.

I am a manager at a local government agency that is mostly fee-for-service, so I
know a little bit about what it takes to recover fees. No one ever wants to pay the
full cost of what it takes for us to provide a service. That being said, I also know
that if I tried to increase the fees over the programs that I supervise by 60%, I'd get
strung up at the next Council meeting. 60% in one year seems excessive and I
would urge you to consider raising fees in a different area than one that effects
foreign adoption.

Thank you for your time,

Jenifer Gilliland

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Jennifer Gilliland
